page.title: 01CHELMSFORD AREA INFORMATION
page.content: The items on the following pages refer to the areas of central, southern and south-western Chelmsford, although the reader will find references to aspects of life applicable throughout the whole of the Borough. {The Borough of Chelmsford}covers some 34,227 hectares(84,596 acres) and contains an{estimated population}(in mid-1984) of 144,000. From May,1985, the office of{Mayor}will be held by Councillor Delmas Ashford. {Physically, the area is situated astride the valleys of the Rivers Wid, Chelmer and Can;the land rising gently to a maximum height of 225 feet. {The area is bisected}diagonally by the A12 trunk road. The western area is largely wooded parkland and farmland, the southern area residential housing estates and the remainder covers the commercial heart of Chelmsford.
